comment: Finance 7020 - This is a Hybrid Class. The class lectures are on YouTube, and his teaching style is completely backwards and confusing. I strongly suggest you Do Not take this professor.

Business Finance (MBA) - Dr. Tompkins will warn you up front that he teaches a tough class and will make it difficult. He did not lie. He made us think a lot and study, but I learned so much in his class. Tests were hard, but he added a heavy curve. There was one group project that was actually fun with little restriction. He's funny and snarky.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects

comment: HONEST REVIEW: I'm 4th yr & I've never worked as hard until his class. VERY tough lectures. He brags to "maximize" your learning-so he purposefully makes exams HARD. He does curve. Also, cold calls during lectures!  2 tests, 1 project. He gives 2% extra credit on top of final grade for showing up to presentations. No phones allowed & no laptops.
rating_tags: EXTRA CREDIT--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Class is two tests and one project. Tests are in person, mostly short answer. Makes some things unnecessarily difficult. Overall not too bad to pass or get a B
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: I really appreciate the effort he puts into making the class engaging and effective. The YouTube lectures were incredibly helpful for preparing ahead of class, allowing us to grasp the material at our own pace. Exams were easy, but he will tell you they are going to be challenging. Take good notes, watch the lectures, study, and you will get an A
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Lecture heavy--Graded by few things

comment: Professor Tompkins is probably the best teacher at KSU. He is very understanding, and has such a deep understanding of the material he teaches he could probably make a third grader understand why inflation has an impact on exchange rates.
rating_tags: Amazing lectures --Gives good feedback--Inspirational

comment: I took this course in the summer of 2023; it was a strange class with very little to no math. The professor only  discussed the theories behind the concepts. A terrible corporate finance lecturer!
rating_tags: Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: I went to classes daily, not missing a single one. studied. Tests and quizzes are made to be impossible, and there are no curves. Scraped with a C-. Awful!

The class material itself is very difficult, but Tompkins is awesome. He does go extremely fast through the notes, but if you miss anything, he has youtube videos. He is funny and makes connections from the material to the real world. He tries to make the material relevant.

Dr.Tompkins is a great professor and clearly understands the topics he is teaching. The subject itself is difficult, but he is very clear in his lectures and gives a ton of supplemental material that is really good for studying for tests. Anybody who says he's a bad teacher probably does not attend class. His exams contains little to no math !
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: I took him for FIN 7020. Overall, a challenging class. 6 tests. Less than 5 questions per test. Very vague with how he grades. Highly do NOT recommend if you have a disability or any type of accommodation.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lecture heavy--Test heavy

comment: "You either love or hate his class" It was not a good class for me. You can look at his YouTube channel before becoming a student; his classes are exactly like that, with little to no math, which was strange to me. His tests consist of a few questions, and if you get one wrong that makes a difference. Optional group project or final examination.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Graded by few things

comment: Business Finance is definitely a tough course but Professor Tompkins puts each concept in simple terms that makes it much easier to understand. He makes sure you follow along throughout the entire lecture and is very happy to answer / clear up anything. 5 quizzes and 2 group case studies. Quizzes are very challenging and require a lot of studying.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Amazing lectures --Test heavy

comment: Professor Tompkins is easily one of the best professors I've ever had. I completed this as a summer class and I have learned more than in any other class at KSU. He is difficult but he really cares about your learning. Not an easy A but I enjoyed myself and came to love Finance through his teaching. Make sure to participate in class!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Caring

comment: Professor Tompkins is a great guy. I was wary of taking him after reading his reviews because people call him arrogant, but he is certainly not and is just from a different country with different culture. 2 Tests, 4 quizzes (1 dropped), optional project that replaces final. comment: I'm not one to ever leave a review. However, this professor was more than worthy of one. Despite only receiving a B, I learned more in this class than any other college course at KSU. Lots of study time, but it will be worth it.

comment: Dr. Tompkins teaches for understanding, not memorization. Come to class, participate and pay attention. I cannot stress enough how important coming to class and paying attention are.

comment: If you're too lazy to go to class, study, this is not a course for you. If you are willing to be challenged and (god forbid) learn something, you'll do fine. As long as you work hard (go to every class and start studying for exams way ahead of time) you will be fine.  Deep breaths.  Relax

This prof cares more about hearing himself talk than your education. My peers busted their butts for B's, and the B is with a curve. On exams, show him exactly the way he shows you. If not, you are wrong. The biggest barrier to your success will be giving Tompkins what he wants the way he wants it.  It's not learning the material.

He is not that hard if you just want to pass. 6 quizzes are 85% of your grade, but they are only few questions each. He grades purely on the curve. His teaching style is to give you a solid understanding of the material which enables you to pass any test he throws at you. He has lectures on YouTube, which REALLY help. Very light workload.

comment: Really great and caring teacher. Offers videos of all lectures so that you can study. He wants you to understand the material and is ALWAYS willing to meet for extra help. Prefers to call you on the phone to answer questions over emailing. Tough grader but completely fair.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Good prof. Cares and gives you multiple opportunities to succeed. Always willing to answer questions outside of class. My first class with him. Tests are hard, but watch the videos. Go to class and pay attention because it helps you learn.  Definitely would take him again! Not an easy class though.
Very hard class.  Does not use textbook.  Wants you to learn to derive formulas you will not ever use; tests impossible; DO NOT TAKE THIS PROFESSOR!!!!!

comment: Great professor and hilarious. I'd recommend taking him in the fall though. Taking him in the summer, four days a week is tougher to manage.
rating_tags: Hilarious--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Tompkins is an amazing teacher. He wants to ensure that you understand everything to the nth degree. His class was one of the hardest classes I have ever taken. That being said, Tompkins knows this and expects a lot but gives a lot of help. He has his own Youtube channel with his lectures to assist in studying. Study and practice a lot****
He's engaging, his lectures are great. I enjoyed his class and the way he teaches.
He is just a great Professor and do not hesitate to take his course.  explains things well.

Great professor. Smart, sharp, understanding. Always willing to answer questions.  I took two of his classes during the summer. Tests are hard, study the lectures. Pay attention in class; attendance not mandatory, but he will give hints for the testsquizzes. Get a good group in 4220. I wish more prof's were like him. Would take again!

I took him for Fall 2013 class. Dr.Tompkins is a Talented Professor with unique teaching style. Starting from our class, he started providing audio powerpoint presentations which turned out to be very helpful. Tests are very challenging, so pay attention to everything he says. Grade consists of a Midterm, Final or Group project and five quizzes.

I took this professor for a maymester and he was incredibly nice and made what could be a boring class interesting. He is very discussion based so you have to be willing to participate. Grades easily on group project but tests can definitely be tricky and difficult if you don't prepare! He really tries to help you understand the material though!

Very good professor with an interesting teaching style. Tests are not that hard if you understand the material and pay attention to everything he says in class. He will always answer any questions by making you answer it, so be ready. Grade consists of a midterm, final, three quizzes and an optional group project. Take him if you enjoy finance.

This class covers: corporate growth, debt & equity financing, and dividends.  These topics are not taught in other courses.  There are five projects.  The math is not hard.  Explaining the formulas can be difficult.  Exceptional professor!  Exceptional course!

If you want to learn, take Tompkins.  He covers more material and in greater detail than other professors.  He is challenging.  The projects are time consuming, but are graded easily.  The quizzes are hard, but are representative of the test.  Do well on the mid-term and you're set.

Course is quite hard to grasp if you are not a finance person. The professor does a good job in teaching and keeping the class entertaining. Gives theoretical and real life teaching. Exams are hard. Lots of quizzes.

His course is hard but very useful. He encourages you to understand material, and you do learn a lot from taking his class. He does not use textbook. For exams, go through his ppt and understand the material guarantees you a high score. If you choose group project, be thoughtful and be prepared for tough questions. Strongly recommend him.

Took only undergrad class he teaches, and it's hard but worth it. Was 2nd finance class I took and it has really helped me with following classes. Is very fair, good guy, don't take if not willing to study at least 1hr/week outside of class. Teaches to understanding not memorization.
One of the best Professors I've ever had. Easy A if you attend classes and pay attention.

Great prof. The subject itself is very hard and he makes all the effort to make it easy for you to understand. You can easily make A in his class if you sit at least 2-3 hrs a week to go over the material discussed and do examples from slides. Don't miss a class, otherwise you may not get the topic. Exams are very straightforward, no tricks.
Prof is very thorough, lectures can be boring at times, he is a tough grader so study hard don't wait till the last minute!

Avoid if you can.  He loves the material and tries very hard to make it easy to understand, but the tests are ridiculous!  The optional group project takes forever and grading seems inconsistent.  He doesn't tell you but he cuts off a B at 75.  Yeah, I got a 74 so...C!  Has real world experiance and is really nice, but wouldn't recommend.
Don't take this guy if finance is not your area. He is a good teacher but really hard. Definitely NOT an easy A/B.

This is great prof! Don't think you can get away without preparation, though. You have to be prepared for every single class to be able to understand further. Get prepared only from ppt slides. Use book problems to get prepared for the exams and you can get A. Exams and Quizzes straightforward from slides.Would recommend for those who want to learn

Class is really difficult.  Tests require 20+ point curves because he goes through material so quickly and you dont use the textbook so its really had to do practice problems, examples, etc.  Would not recommend him.

Great professor - he explains the material really well and he wants to make sure that students learn, and not simply memorize information. Discussions can get boring and drawn out but that's what happens when you have a room full of people who "think" they know a lot. Beware: you probably will NEVER use the textbook, so do even bother buying it.

ok this is really personal he does not use the test book and claims he does not want u to memorize any formulars which is a very very bad thing cos most of us got through cal 1 fin 3100 using the formular this guy is bad news stay away if you can 6 quiz u get to drop low score comprehensive final bad bad news yall
Excellent professor.  Highly recommend him.  The key to doing well is come to class and participate in the discussions.  He is extremely intelligent and is eager to teach what he knows.
He is among the best prof's I've had in college. He is very thorough in explaning the theory behind the math in Finance. He will answer questions all day long. He is challenging, but VERY FAIR.

I highly recommend that you do not take this guy for the Principles of Finance class.  You think your gonna do good because he got good ratings from his Graduate students.  Think again.  He makes the challenging material presented in this class, incredibly hard.  His tests are either five multiple choice or one show your work problem, both awful!!!

Ruthless grader, but curves quizes and midterm in the end.  His slides spoon feed you the concepts. Will answer questions all day long. Asks questions about cases & concepts on quizes (not just math.) Skilled at teaching;makes you learn *why* the theory & formulas work,so you don't have to memorize. Stresses fairness. Overall very good prof.
This is probably my best professor at Kennesaw. He teaches. Tough, but you learn a whole lot. Helps keep your brain alive.

I didn't have the same experiance as everyone else. I made a 110 in my last finance class and barly scraped by with a B in Tompkins class. He tries to cram to much material in one class and goes very fast through the material. If you cant keep up in the first 2 or 3 classes I suggest droping. Adams is the better finance instructor of the three for 8010 Finance.
He wants you to learn.  Very good professor.

I thought this class was very easy because 1/3 gets A's and 2/3 gets B's and maybe one person will get a C or a D.  Just get in a good group and study for the midterm and exempt the final.  If you do well enough on the midterm you will get an A for the class.  Hope this helps.
He's tough, but he actually teaches and makes sure that you understand what he is teaching
Mere words pale in describing what a phenomenal teacher and human being he is!  This was the hardest class I've ever had and but he made it one of the most challenging & enjoyable.
Difficult, but worth every penny.
